text: On a social level, the gradual assertion of the rights of individuals is determined in part by the value ((that)) the society places on the individual
speaker: Subject

text: This value not only determines what a society can do to protect the individual, but what contributions individuals can make to society

text: I've lived with time so long as a limiting and controlling reality that I'm ((ruined with)) thinking of it like this. I need new images for time. I am tired of being pushed in front of it, like a child being urged to take its first step or like a pet being dragged along its staccato steps, lurching forward one moment and then seeming to drag on forever. Locked in a room, waiting for its chance to get out
speaker: Subject

text: I can learn to accept a concept of time that is inexorable, leading to one inescapable outcome. But I can never accept a mechanical view of time that allows for no individual experience.
